Package ui

Class ElementRenderer

java.lang.Object
ui.Element
ui.ElementRenderer
public class ElementRenderer extends Element
UIComponentRenderer is the renderable part of a UI component it can contain a solid color, a semi-transparent color, or a texture. Sprites can be tinted by the color value.
Since:
11.9.2021
Author:
Asher Haun

    • ElementRenderer

      public ElementRenderer(Color color, org.joml.Vector2f size)
      Create the spriteRenderer using a Color object, no sprite.
      Parameters:
      color - of type Color, range from 0-255

    • ElementRenderer

      public ElementRenderer(Sprite sprite, org.joml.Vector2f size)
      Create a spriteRenderer using a sprite that is already loaded. Default tint color is white (no tinting visible).
      Parameters:
      sprite -

    • ElementRenderer

      public ElementRenderer(String path, org.joml.Vector2f size)
      Create a spriteRenderer using an image from the fileSystem.
      Parameters:
      path - to the image (ie. "src/assets/images/pepper.png")

    • isDirty

      public boolean isDirty()
      Used by the renderer to determine if this sprite should be sent back to the GPU to be redrawn.
      Returns:
      true or false if the sprite or color has changes since last draw.

    • markDirty

      Mark this Sprite renderer as dirty
